intro: Bupleurum rotundifolium subsp. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate round-leaved bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its round or oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and steppes. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
